thread.title: Photos reveal misleading food packaging | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Photos reveal misleading food packaging | Daily Mail Online

author: Martha Cliff For Mailonline
title: Photos reveal misleading food packaging | Daily Mail Online
text: This contradictory cookie packaging claims that this gluten-free treat... contains gluten One ultra-observant shopper apparently thwarted Campbell soup's claim that their tins were getting bigger This rather contradictory packaging would likely have left some hyper-patriotic Americans unimpressed You can't really argue with this person's proof, although you can question why they would have spent their time counting out every raisin in a box of cereal Looking at the packet you would expect a generous topping of pepperoni however this customer is likely disappointed once they opened their Italian snack It looks as though this Poptart may have been left out of the frosting department with barely a smattering of icing seen on the pastry The reality of a McFloat seems some what sadder than the colourful drink advertised Bizarrely the heads and the tails of these shrimp have been separated to make them appear bigger than they are The diner of a canned ravioli was bound to be disappointed to find the tin only contained one piece of the pasta This berry loaf is doing little to live up to its expectations with one lonely cranberry featuring in the bread While this lolly promises a panda shaped treat the ice cream is unrecognisable as any animal
